Starting Position: Begin by sitting comfortably on the floor or on a yoga mat with your legs crossed. Place your hands on your knees or thighs.
Lengthen the Spine: Sit up tall and lengthen your spine. Imagine your head reaching towards the ceiling while keeping your shoulders relaxed.
Engage the Core: Engage your core muscles slightly to support your spine and maintain stability throughout the pose.

Inhale: As you inhale, elongate your spine even further, feeling the crown of your head lifting towards the sky.
Exhale: On the exhale, gently lean towards the right side, keeping both sitting bones grounded on the floor. Avoid collapsing into the stretch; instead, maintain length along your left side.
Side Bend: Extend your left arm overhead and reach towards the right, feeling a gentle stretch along the left side of your torso. Keep your right hand grounded for support.

Shoulder and Neck: Relax your shoulders away from your ears and soften your facial muscles. Avoid shrugging or tensing the shoulders during the side bend.
Breathing: Maintain steady and even breathing throughout the pose. Inhale to lengthen the spine, and exhale to deepen the side bend without straining.

Explore Range of Motion: Move into the side bend only as far as feels comfortable for your body. Respect your limits and avoid pushing into pain or discomfort.
Hold and Feel the Stretch: Hold the pose for 3-5 breaths or longer if comfortable, feeling the stretch along the left side of your body. Allow each breath to deepen the sensation of the stretch.
